an3.29:4.1: “These three people are found in the world.
an3.29:4.3: The blind, the one-eyed, and the two-eyed.
an3.29:4.5: It’s someone who doesn’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth or to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
an3.29:4.6: Nor do they have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between qualities that are wholesome and unwholesome, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
an3.29:4.7: This is called a blind person.
an3.29:5.1: Who is the person with one eye?
an3.29:5.2: It’s someone who has the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
an3.29:5.3: But they don’t have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between qualities that are wholesome and unwholesome, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
an3.29:5.4: This is called a one-eyed person.
an3.29:6.1: Who is the person with two eyes?
an3.29:6.2: It’s someone who has the kind of vision that’s needed to acquire more wealth and to increase the wealth they’ve already acquired.
an3.29:6.3: And they have the kind of vision that’s needed to know the difference between wholesome and unwholesome, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, or qualities on the side of dark and bright.
an3.29:6.5: This is called a two-eyed person.
an3.29:6.6: These are the three people found in the world.”
